answers.answer: Hi,I understand your concern regarding your results especially with your previous history. The thyroglobulin test is primarily used as a tumor marker to evaluate the effectiveness of treatment as well as monitor for recurrence. In monitoring for cancer recurrence, change over time is more important than one particular thyroglobulin test result, hence, it is important to have serial thyroglobulin tests performed at the same laboratory. The thyroglobulin antibody (TgAb) test, on the other hand,  is usually  ordered along with the thyroglobulin test and a positive test for  antithyroglobulin antibodies may be due to a variety of issues also such as Graves disease, Hypothyroidism, Thyrotoxicosis, diabetes and even pregnant women and relatives of those with autoimmune thyroiditis. It is best that you discuss the results with your attending physician. Your medical history, diagnosis, symptoms and results of other diagnostic tests may need to be done. Take care and do keep us posted.

question: I have been off of this board for a while but I need some support amd answers right now. I have an appointment next Monday but got lab results online today.My thyroglobulin Qn was 19.5Antithyroglobulin Ab	<1.0		IU/mL(they called this comprehensive thyroglobulin)Antithyroglobulin Ab	<20	0 - 40	IU/mLEverything has always been fine and undetected. I'm 6 years post TT and RAI. Actually after my 5 year mark my tsh has been in the normal range due to other issues I had being suppressed. Has this happened to anyone else and what does  this mean? A recurrence?
title: Elevated thyroglobulin levels
